.```python
# Top 10 games by Global Sales
top10_games = df.nlargest(10, 'Global_Sales')[['Name', 'Platform', 'Year', 'Genre', 'Global_Sales']]
print("Top 10 games by Global Sales:")
print(top10_games)

# Average Global Sales by Genre (only genres with at least 100 games)
genre_counts = df['Genre'].value_counts()
valid_genres = genre_counts[genre_counts >= 100].index
avg_sales_by_genre = df[df['Genre'].isin(valid_genres)].groupby('Genre')['Global_Sales'].mean().sort_values(ascending=False)
print("\nAverage Global Sales by Genre (>=100 games):")
print(avg_sales_by_genre)

# Average Global Sales by Platform (top 10 platforms by game count)
platform_counts = df['Platform'].value_counts().head(10).index
avg_sales_by_platform = df[df['Platform'].isin(platform_counts)].groupby('Platform')['Global_Sales'].mean().sort_values(ascending=False)
print("\nAverage Global Sales by Platform (top 10 platforms):")
print(avg_sales_by_platform)

# Distribution of Year (games released per year)
games_per_year = df['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()
print("\nNumber of games released each year (first 15 years):")
print(games_per_year.head(15))
```

Use statsmodels OLS: sm.OLS(df['Global_Sales'], sm.add_constant(df['Year'])).fit().
Create a column with the region having max sales per row, then pd.crosstab(Genre, dominant_region) and scipy.stats.chi2_contingency.
